attributes.longname: Surface Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Calcite in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure calcite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.
attributes.comment: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure calcite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.

attributes.longname: Phosphorus Production
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Vertically integrated biogenic phosphorus production
attributes.comment: Vertically integrated biogenic phosphorus production

attributes.longname: Total Dissolved Inorganic Phosphorus Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic phosphorus" means the sum of all inorganic phosphorus in solution (including phosphate, hydrogen phosphate, dihydrogen phosphate, and phosphoric acid).
attributes.comment: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic phosphorus" means the sum of all inorganic phosphorus in solution (including phosphate, hydrogen phosphate, dihydrogen phosphate, and phosphoric acid).

attributes.longname: Grid Averaged Methane Emissions from Wetlands
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Net upward flux of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).
attributes.comment: Net upward flux of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

attributes.longname: Calcite Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)
attributes.comment: sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

attributes.longname: Iron Limitation of Diazotrophs
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.
attributes.comment: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

attributes.longname: Y-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: Y-component of ocean stress on sea ice
attributes.comment: Y-component of ocean stress on sea ice

attributes.longname: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Nitrogen
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
attributes.description: Net time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4)
attributes.comment: Net time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4)

attributes.longname: Upwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconca)
attributes.description: the upwelling longwave flux over sea ice (always negative)
attributes.comment: the upwelling longwave flux over sea ice (always negative)

attributes.longname: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Air Temperature
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean time: minimum within days time: mean over days
attributes.description: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute "time: min")
attributes.comment: monthly mean of the daily-minimum near-surface air temperature.

attributes.longname: Percentage Cover of Sea Ice by Meltpond
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: Percentage of sea ice, by area, which is covered by melt ponds, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice .
attributes.comment: Percentage of sea ice, by area, which is covered by melt ponds, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice .

attributes.longname: Sea Water Salinity at Sea Floor
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Model prognostic salinity at bottom-most model grid cell
attributes.comment: Model prognostic salinity at bottom-most model grid cell

attributes.longname: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: sum of phytoplankton nitrogen component concentrations
attributes.comment: sum of phytoplankton nitrogen component concentrations

attributes.longname: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as Abiotic CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Gas exchange flux of abiotic CO2 (positive into ocean)
attributes.comment: Gas exchange flux of abiotic CO2 (positive into ocean)

attributes.longname: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC12
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC12 is CF2Cl2.  The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane.
attributes.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC12 is CF2Cl2.  The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane.

attributes.longname: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.
attributes.comment: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.

attributes.longname: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
attributes.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
attributes.description: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized eddy-induced advective transport due to any subgrid advective process. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.
attributes.comment: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized eddy-induced advective transport due to any subgrid advective process. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

attributes.longname: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
attributes.comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

attributes.longname: Divergence of the Sea-Ice Velocity Field
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) time: point
attributes.time_title: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value)
attributes.description: Divergence of sea-ice velocity field (first shear strain invariant)
attributes.comment: Divergence of sea-ice velocity field (first shear strain invariant)

attributes.longname: Lateral Transfer of Nitrogen out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: leached nitrogen etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.
attributes.comment: leached nitrogen etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.

attributes.longname: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.
attributes.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

attributes.longname: Surface Downward Northward Wind Stress
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Downward northward wind stress at the surface
attributes.comment: Downward northward wind stress at the surface

attributes.longname: Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Abiotic Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration
attributes.comment: Abiotic Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

attributes.longname: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass per unit area from the surface resulting from their direct conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.
attributes.comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass from the surface resulting from their conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.

attributes.longname: Surface Air Pressure
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates
attributes.comment: not, in general, the same as mean sea-level pressure

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Including All Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: From all sources,  Including natural, anthropogenic and Land-use change. Only total fire emissions can be compared to observations.
attributes.comment: From all sources,  Including natural, anthropogenic and Land-use change. Only total fire emissions can be compared to observations.

attributes.longname: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Other Phytoplankton
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Primary (organic carbon) production by other phytoplankton components alone
attributes.comment: Primary (organic carbon) production by other phytoplankton components alone

attributes.longname: Total Nitrogen Lost (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and Leaching)
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Not all models split losses into gaseous and leaching
attributes.comment: Not all models split losses into gaseous and leaching

attributes.longname: Lateral Sea Ice Melt Rate
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: The rate of change of sea ice mass through lateral melting divided by grid-cell area (report 0 if not explicitly calculated thermodynamically)
attributes.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass through lateral melting divided by grid-cell area (report 0 if not explicitly calculated thermodynamically)

attributes.longname: Surface Temperature of Sea Ice
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: Report surface temperature of snow where snow covers the sea ice.
attributes.comment: Report surface temperature of snow where snow covers the sea ice.

attributes.longname: Heterotrophic Respiration on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac)
attributes.description: Total RH of grass in the grid cell
attributes.comment: Total RH of grass in the grid cell

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Wood debris" means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent.
attributes.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Wood debris" means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent.

attributes.longname: Surface Dissolved Iron Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: dissolved iron in sea water is meant to include both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not, e.g., particulate detrital iron)
attributes.comment: dissolved iron in sea water is meant to include both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not, e.g., particulate detrital iron)

attributes.longname: Nitrogen Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stem and Root
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: E.g. fruits, seeds, etc.
attributes.comment: E.g. fruits, seeds, etc.

attributes.longname: Surface Mole Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: carbon concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone
attributes.comment: carbon concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

attributes.longname: Carbon-14 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: The rate of synthesis of carbon-14 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.
attributes.comment: The rate of synthesis of carbon-14 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

attributes.longname: Percentage Cover by Shrub
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.
attributes.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.

attributes.longname: Nitrogen Mass in Vegetation
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.
attributes.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

attributes.longname: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
attributes.comment: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

attributes.longname: Sea Level Pressure
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Sea Level Pressure
attributes.comment: not, in general, the same as surface pressure

attributes.longname: Downward Flux of Aragonite
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. Aragonite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of aragonite is CaCO3. Standard names also exist for calcite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.
attributes.comment: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. Aragonite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of aragonite is CaCO3. Standard names also exist for calcite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.

attributes.longname: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
attributes.comment: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4

attributes.longname: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Silicon in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: sum of phytoplankton silica component concentrations
attributes.comment: sum of phytoplankton silica component concentrations

attributes.longname: Calcite Production
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Vertically integrated calcite production
attributes.comment: Vertically integrated calcite production

attributes.longname: Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-14 Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Dissolved inorganic carbon-14 (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration
attributes.comment: Dissolved inorganic carbon-14 (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

attributes.longname: Dissolved Organic Carbon Content
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Vertically integrated DOC (explicit pools only)
attributes.comment: Vertically integrated DOC (explicit pools only)

attributes.longname: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Evaporation or Sublimation
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: the rate of change of snow mass through sublimation and evaporation divided by sea-ice area
attributes.comment: the rate of change of snow mass through sublimation and evaporation divided by sea-ice area

attributes.longname: Global Mean Mole Fraction of HCFC22
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for HCFC22 is CHClF2.  The IUPAC name for HCFC22 is chloro-difluoro-methane.
attributes.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for HCFC22 is CHClF2.  The IUPAC name for HCFC22 is chloro-difluoro-methane.

attributes.longname: Net Primary Production Allocated to Stem as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: added for completeness with npp_root
attributes.comment: added for completeness with npp_root

attributes.longname: Sea Water Pressure at Sea Water Surface
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.  "Sea water pressure" is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.
attributes.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.  "Sea water pressure" is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.

attributes.longname: Surface Mole Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: carbon concentration from calcareous (calcite-producing) phytoplankton component alone
attributes.comment: carbon concentration from calcareous (calcite-producing) phytoplankton component alone

attributes.longname: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass per unit area from the surface resulting from their direct conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.
attributes.comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass resulting from their conversion to water vapor.  Computed as the total sublimation on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing for snow-free land regions; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0.

attributes.longname: Downward Flux of Calcite
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Downward flux of Calcite
attributes.comment: Downward flux of Calcite

attributes.longname: Condensed Water Path
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
attributes.comment: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

attributes.longname: Sea Water Potential Temperature at Sea Floor
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Potential temperature at the ocean bottom-most grid cell.
attributes.comment: Potential temperature at the ocean bottom-most grid cell.

attributes.longname: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
attributes.comment: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.

attributes.longname: Square of Sea Surface Salinity
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.
attributes.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

attributes.longname: Surface Mole Concentration of Other Zooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: carbon from additional zooplankton component concentrations alone (e.g. Micro, meso).  Since the models all have different numbers of components, this variable has been included to provide a check for intercomparison between models since some phytoplankton groups are supersets.
attributes.comment: carbon from additional zooplankton component concentrations alone (e.g. Micro, meso).  Since the models all have different numbers of components, this variable has been included to provide a check for intercomparison between models since some phytoplankton groups are supersets.

attributes.longname: Total Plant Nitrogen Uptake (Sum of Ammonium and Nitrate) Irrespective of the Source of Nitrogen
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: The uptake of nitrogen by fixation: nitrogen fixation means the uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere.
attributes.comment: The uptake of nitrogen by fixation: nitrogen fixation means the uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere.

attributes.longname: Irradiance Limitation of Calcareous Phytoplankton
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Growth limitation of calcareous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.
attributes.comment: Growth limitation of calcareous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

attributes.longname: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
attributes.comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

attributes.longname: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: zero for models using real water fluxes.
attributes.comment: zero for models using real water fluxes.

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.
attributes.comment: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

attributes.longname: Total Respiration from Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Total autotrophic respiration from all belowground plant parts.  This has benchmarking value because the sum of Rh and root respiration can be compared to observations of total soil respiration.
attributes.comment: Total autotrophic respiration from all belowground plant parts.  This has benchmarking value because the sum of Rh and root respiration can be compared to observations of total soil respiration.

attributes.longname: Northward Wind
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean
attributes.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).
attributes.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

attributes.longname: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Calcareous Phytoplankton
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Primary (organic carbon) production by the calcite-producing phytoplankton component alone
attributes.comment: Primary (organic carbon) production by the calcite-producing phytoplankton component alone

attributes.longname: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Upward geothermal heat flux per unit area on the sea floor
attributes.comment: Upward geothermal heat flux per unit area on the sea floor

attributes.longname: Sea Water X Velocity
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean
attributes.description: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
attributes.comment: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

attributes.longname: Square of Sea Surface Temperature
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Square of temperature of liquid ocean.
attributes.comment: Square of temperature of liquid ocean, averaged over the day.

attributes.longname: Snow Mass per Area
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: Total mass of snow on sea ice divided by sea-ice area.
attributes.comment: (in OImon, sim included snow and sea ice mass)

attributes.longname: Gross Primary Production on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac)
attributes.description: Total GPP of grass in the grid cell
attributes.comment: Total GPP of grass in the grid cell

attributes.longname: Maximum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean time: maximum
attributes.description: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
attributes.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.

attributes.longname: Needleleaf Deciduous Tree Area Percentage
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.description: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by needleleaf deciduous trees.
attributes.comment: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by needleleaf deciduous trees.

attributes.longname: Sea Water Mass
attributes.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Total mass of liquid sea water. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.
attributes.comment: Total mass of liquid sea water. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Shrub Tiles
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac)
attributes.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.
attributes.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.

attributes.longname: Atmospheric Drag Coefficient
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: Atmospheric drag coefficient that is used to calculate the atmospheric momentum drag on sea ice
attributes.comment: Atmospheric drag coefficient that is used to calculate the atmospheric momentum drag on sea ice

attributes.longname: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as Abiotic 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Gas exchange flux of abiotic 14CO2 (positive into ocean)
attributes.comment: Gas exchange flux of abiotic 14CO2 (positive into ocean)

attributes.longname: Abiotic Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2. In ocean biogeochemistry models, an "abiotic analogue" is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure difference between sea water and air is positive when the partial pressure of the dissolved gas in sea water is greater than the partial pressure in air.
attributes.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2. In ocean biogeochemistry models, an "abiotic analogue" is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure difference between sea water and air is positive when the partial pressure of the dissolved gas in sea water is greater than the partial pressure in air.

attributes.longname: Oxygen Minimum Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The concentration of any chemical species, whether particulate or dissolved, may vary with depth in the ocean.  A depth profile may go through one or more local minima in concentration. The mole_concentration_of_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water_at_shallowest_local_minimum_in_vertical_profile is the mole concentration of oxygen at the local minimum in the concentration profile that occurs closest to the sea surface.
attributes.comment: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The concentration of any chemical species, whether particulate or dissolved, may vary with depth in the ocean.  A depth profile may go through one or more local minima in concentration. The mole_concentration_of_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water_at_shallowest_local_minimum_in_vertical_profile is the mole concentration of oxygen at the local minimum in the concentration profile that occurs closest to the sea surface.

attributes.longname: Natural pH
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.
attributes.comment: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1 (natural component).

attributes.longname: Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-14 Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Abiotic Dissolved inorganic carbon-14 (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration
attributes.comment: Abiotic Dissolved inorganic 14carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

attributes.longname: Surface Downward Net Flux of Iron
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Iron supply through deposition flux onto sea surface, runoff, coasts, sediments, etc
attributes.comment: Iron supply through deposition flux onto sea surface, runoff, coasts, sediments, etc

attributes.longname: Convective Precipitation
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Convective precipitation at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.
attributes.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

attributes.longname: Water Evaporation Flux Where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
attributes.description: computed as the total mass of water vapor evaporating from the ice-free portion of the ocean  divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
attributes.comment: computed as the total mass of water vapor evaporating from the ice-free portion of the ocean  divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

attributes.longname: Percentage of Grid Cell That Is Land but neither Vegetation Covered nor Bare Soil
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by  neither vegetation nor bare-soil (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)
attributes.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by "non-vegetation" and "non-bare-soil" (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)

attributes.longname: Compressive Sea Ice Strength
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: Computed strength of the ice pack, defined as the energy (J m-2) dissipated per unit area removed from the ice pack under compression, and assumed proportional to the change in potential energy caused by ridging. For Hibler-type models, this is P (= P*h exp(-C(1-A)) where P* is compressive strength, h ice thickness, A compactness and C strength reduction constant).
attributes.comment: Computed strength of the ice pack, defined as the energy (J m-2) dissipated per unit area removed from the ice pack under compression, and assumed proportional to the change in potential energy caused by ridging. For Hibler-type models, this is P (= P*h exp(-C(1-A)) where P* is compressive strength, h ice thickness, A compactness and C strength reduction constant).

attributes.longname: Percentage Cover by C4 Crops
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 crops
attributes.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 crops

attributes.longname: Flux of Inorganic Carbon into Ocean Surface by Runoff
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Inorganic Carbon supply to ocean through runoff (separate from gas exchange)
attributes.comment: Inorganic Carbon supply to ocean through runoff (separate from gas exchange)

attributes.longname: Wetland Percentage Cover
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by wetland. Report only one year if  fixed percentage is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.
attributes.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by wetland. Report only one year if  fixed percentage is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.

attributes.longname: Ocean Grid-Cell Mass per Area
attributes.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Tracer grid-cell mass per unit area used for computing tracer budgets. For Boussinesq models with static ocean grid cell thickness, masscello = rhozero*thickcello, where thickcello is static cell thickness and rhozero is constant Boussinesq reference density. More generally, masscello is time dependent and reported as part of Omon.
attributes.comment: For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times grid celll volume.

attributes.longname: Surface Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.
attributes.comment: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.

attributes.longname: Water Flux into Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum *wfonocorr* and *wfcorr*.
attributes.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum *wfonocorr* and *wfcorr*.

attributes.longname: Iron Production
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Vertically integrated biogenic iron production
attributes.comment: Vertically integrated biogenic iron production

attributes.longname: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean grid_longitude: mean
attributes.description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
attributes.comment: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

attributes.longname: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area
attributes.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Products of Land-Use Change
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through  land use change.
attributes.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through  land use change.

attributes.cell_methods: time: mean

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

attributes.comment: Abiotic Dissolved inorganic 14carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

attributes.longname: Y-Component of Sea-Ice Velocity
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: The y-velocity of ice on native model grid

attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Stem
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: including sapwood and hardwood.

attributes.longname: Abiotic Delta Pco Partial Pressure
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Difference in partial pressure of abiotic-analogue carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. An abiotic analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored.
attributes.comment: Difference in partial pressure of abiotic-analogue carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. An abiotic analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored.

attributes.longname: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
attributes.comment: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

attributes.longname: Percentage Cloud Cover
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Percentage cloud cover, including both large-scale and convective cloud.
attributes.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

attributes.comment: Total area of all Southern-Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15 % areal fraction of sea ice

attributes.longname: Minimum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

attributes.longname: Total Respiration from Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]
attributes.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation, Litter or Soil Pools into the Atmosphere Due to any Human Activity [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Anthropogenic flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. That is, emissions influenced, caused, or created by human activity. Anthropogenic emission of carbon dioxide includes fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change, except forest regrowth.
attributes.comment: Anthropogenic flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. That is, emissions influenced, caused, or created by human activity. Anthropogenic emission of carbon dioxide includes fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change, except forest regrowth.

attributes.longname: Height of Pastures
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where pastures (comment: mask=pastureFrac)
attributes.description: Vegetation height averaged over the pasture fraction of a grid cell.
attributes.comment: Vegetation height averaged over the pasture fraction of a grid cell.

attributes.longname: Decomposition out of Product Pools to CO2 in Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of "forestry and agricultural products" are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.
attributes.comment: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of "forestry and agricultural products" are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.

attributes.longname: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
attributes.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

attributes.comment: Includes transport of both sea ice and snow by advection

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward".  When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance".  In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance".  In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  "shortwave" means shortwave radiation.

When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance".  In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". attributes.longname: Iron Limitation of Picophytoplankton
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.
attributes.comment: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

attributes.longname: Nitrogen Mass in Roots

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Roots
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

attributes.longname: Net Nitrogen Release from Soil and Litter as the Outcome of Nitrogen Immobilisation and Gross Mineralisation
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Loss of soil nitrogen through remineralization and immobilisation. Remineralization is the degradation of organic matter into inorganic forms of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus and other micronutrients, which consumes oxygen and releases energy. Immobilisation of nitrogen refers to retention of nitrogen by micro-organisms under certain conditions, making it unavailable for plants.
attributes.comment: Loss of soil nitrogen through remineralization and immobilisation. Remineralization is the degradation of organic matter into inorganic forms of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus and other micronutrients, which consumes oxygen and releases energy. Immobilisation of nitrogen refers to retention of nitrogen by micro-organisms under certain conditions, making it unavailable for plants.

attributes.longname: Sea Water Vertical Velocity
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean
attributes.description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward).
attributes.comment: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

attributes.longname: Eastward Wind
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean
attributes.description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).
attributes.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

attributes.longname: Maximum Shear Stress in Sea Ice

attributes.longname: Carbon-13 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: The rate of synthesis of carbon-13 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.
attributes.comment: The rate of synthesis of carbon-13 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

attributes.longname: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.
attributes.comment: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.

attributes.longname: Pressure at Model Full-Levels
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years

attributes.comment: Air pressure on model levels

attributes.longname: Grid Averaged Methane Consumption (Methanotrophy) from Wetlands
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Biological consumption (methanotrophy) of methane (NH4) by wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).
attributes.comment: Biological consumption (methanotrophy) of methane (NH4) by wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

attributes.longname: Near-Surface Specific Humidity
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Near-surface (usually, 2 meter) specific humidity.
attributes.comment: Near-surface (usually, 2 meter) specific humidity.

attributes.longname: Mole Concentration of CFC11 in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen". The chemical formula of CFC11 is CFCl3. The IUPAC name for CFC11 is trichloro-fluoro-methane.
attributes.comment: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen". The chemical formula of CFC11 is CFCl3. The IUPAC name for CFC11 is trichloro-fluoro-methane.

attributes.longname: Nitrogen Limitation of Diazotrophs
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.
attributes.comment: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

attributes.longname: Surface Abiotic pH
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.
attributes.comment: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

attributes.longname: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean grid_longitude: mean
attributes.description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
attributes.comment: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

attributes.longname: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux Under Sea Ice
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: the net sensible heat flux under sea ice from the ocean
attributes.comment: the net sensible heat flux under sea ice from the ocean

attributes.longname: Sea Water Surface Downward Y Stress
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean
attributes.description: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
attributes.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

attributes.longname: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Frazil Ice Formation
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Frazil" consists of needle like crystals of ice, typically between three and four millimeters in diameter, which form as sea water begins to freeze. Salt is expelled during the freezing process and frazil ice consists of nearly pure fresh water.
attributes.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Frazil" consists of needle like crystals of ice, typically between three and four millimeters in diameter, which form as sea water begins to freeze. Salt is expelled during the freezing process and frazil ice consists of nearly pure fresh water.

attributes.longname: Dissolved Iron Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Dissolved iron in sea water,  including both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not particulate detrital iron)
attributes.comment: dissolved iron in sea water is meant to include both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not, e.g., particulate detrital iron)

attributes.longname: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Diatoms
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

attributes.comment: Primary (organic carbon) production by the diatom component alone

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

attributes.comment: leached carbon etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.

attributes.longname: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area from vegetation directly into soil, without intermediate conversion to litter.
attributes.comment: In some models part of carbon (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.

attributes.longname: Temperature at Ice-Ocean Interface
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

attributes.comment: Report temperature at interface, NOT temperature within lowermost model layer

attributes.longname: Dissolved Ammonium Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

attributes.comment: Primary (organic carbon) production by the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

attributes.longname: Sea-Ice Area Percentage (Ocean Grid)
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice
attributes.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice

attributes.longname: Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
attributes.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

attributes.longname: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Mortality
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

attributes.longname: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Litter on Shrub Tiles

attributes.description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.
attributes.comment: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.

attributes.longname: Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)

attributes.comment: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by coriolis force

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Soil on Tree Tiles
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac)
attributes.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The "soil content" of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including content_of_soil_layer are used.
attributes.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The "soil content" of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including content_of_soil_layer are used.

attributes.longname: Snow Heat Content per Unit Area
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: Heat-content of all snow in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Snow-water equivalent at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of sea ice.
attributes.comment: Heat-content of all snow in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Snow-water equivalent at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of sea ice.

attributes.longname: Surface Dissolved Organic Carbon Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

attributes.comment: Sum of dissolved carbon component concentrations explicitly represented (i.e. not ~40 uM refractory unless explicit)

attributes.longname: Virtual Salt Flux Correction
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.
attributes.comment: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

attributes.longname: Delta O2 Partial Pressure
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume.  The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.
attributes.comment: The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume.  The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Grass Tiles
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac)
attributes.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

attributes.comment: Sum of dissolved carbon component concentrations explicitly represented (i.e. not ~40 uM refractory unless explicit)

attributes.longname: Surface Total Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic silicon" means the sum of all inorganic silicon in solution (including silicic acid and its first dissociated anion SiO(OH)3-).

attributes.longname: Temperature Flux Due to Rainfall Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
attributes.description: This is defined as "where ice_free_sea over sea"; i.e., the total flux (considered here) entering the ice-free portion of the grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  All such heat fluxes are computed based on Celsius scale.

attributes.longname: Sea Water Salinity

attributes.description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

attributes.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 pasture
