attributes.comment: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in soil.

attributes.longname: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.
attributes.comment: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

attributes.longname: Mole Fraction of CH4
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean
attributes.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
attributes.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

attributes.longname: Flux of Organic Carbon into Ocean Surface by Runoff
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Organic Carbon supply to ocean through runoff (separate from gas exchange)
attributes.comment: Organic Carbon supply to ocean through runoff (separate from gas exchange)

attributes.longname: Net Primary Production on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.
attributes.comment: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.

attributes.longname: Surface Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-13 Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Near surface dissolved inorganic carbon-13 (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration
attributes.comment: Dissolved inorganic 14carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

attributes.longname: Square of Sea Surface Height Above Geoid
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Surface ocean geoid defines z=0.
attributes.comment: Surface ocean geoid defines z=0.

attributes.longname: Surface Dissolved Oxygen Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'.
attributes.comment: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'.

attributes.longname: Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
attributes.comment: includes both evaporation and sublimation

attributes.longname: Surface Snow Amount
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: The mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0; excludes snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.
attributes.comment: Computed as the mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0; excluded is snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.

attributes.longname: Mass Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: chlorophyll concentration from the calcite-producing phytoplankton component alone
attributes.comment: chlorophyll concentration from the calcite-producing phytoplankton component alone

attributes.longname: Liquid Water Content of Soil Layer
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in liquid phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"
attributes.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in liquid phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

attributes.longname: Surface Bacterial Carbon Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Sum of bacterial carbon component concentrations
attributes.comment: sum of bacterial carbon component concentrations

attributes.longname: Sea-Ice Area Percentage Tendency Due to Dynamics
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence...)
attributes.comment: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence...)

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool Above 1m Depth
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.
attributes.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

attributes.longname: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Gas exchange flux of carbon-14 as CO2 (positive into ocean)
attributes.comment: Gas exchange flux of carbon-14 as CO2 (positive into ocean)

attributes.longname: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model : I.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.
attributes.comment: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.

attributes.longname: Sea-Ice Volume per Area
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area (this used to be called ice thickness in CMIP5)
attributes.comment: Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area (this used to be called ice thickness in CMIP5)

attributes.longname: Total Nitrogen in All Terrestrial Nitrogen Pools
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.
attributes.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

attributes.longname: Silicon Production
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Vertically integrated biogenic silica production
attributes.comment: Vertically integrated biogenic silica production

attributes.longname: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
attributes.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
attributes.description: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.
attributes.comment: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

attributes.longname: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Global mean Nitrous Oxide (N2O)
attributes.comment: Global mean Nitrous Oxide (N2O)

attributes.longname: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
attributes.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

attributes.longname: Natural Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2. In ocean biogeochemistry models, a "natural analogue" is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure difference between sea water and air is positive when the partial pressure of the dissolved gas in sea water is greater than the partial pressure in air.
attributes.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2. In ocean biogeochemistry models, a "natural analogue" is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure difference between sea water and air is positive when the partial pressure of the dissolved gas in sea water is greater than the partial pressure in air.

attributes.longname: Mass of 14C in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil, and forestry and agricultural products (e.g. paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock).
attributes.comment: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil, and forestry and agricultural products (e.g. paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock).

attributes.longname: Mole Fraction of O3
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean
attributes.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
attributes.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

attributes.longname: Ice Water Path
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
attributes.comment: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Vegetation
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Carbon mass per unit area in vegetation.
attributes.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in vegetation.

attributes.longname: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC11
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC11 is CFCl3.  The IUPAC name for CFC11 is trichloro-fluoro-methane.
attributes.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC11 is CFCl3.  The IUPAC name for CFC11 is trichloro-fluoro-methane.

attributes.longname: Irradiance Limitation of Diatoms
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Growth limitation of diatoms due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.
attributes.comment: Growth limitation of diatoms due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

attributes.longname: Sea-Ice Mass Change from Dynamics
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Total change in sea-ice mass through dynamics-related processes (advection,...) divided by grid-cell area
attributes.comment: Total change in sea-ice mass through dynamics-related processes (advection,...) divided by grid-cell area

attributes.longname: Mole Fraction of N2O
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years
attributes.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.
attributes.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

attributes.longname: Dissolved Oxygen Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'.
attributes.comment: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'.

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass Flux from Litter, CWD or any non-Living Pool into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources
attributes.comment: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources

attributes.longname: Surface Carbonate Ion Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).
attributes.comment: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Leaves
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Carbon mass per unit area in leaves.
attributes.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in leaves.

attributes.longname: Tree Cover Percentage
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.
attributes.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.

attributes.longname: Relative Humidity
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean
attributes.description: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
attributes.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

attributes.longname: Soil Liquid Water Content
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: The mass (summed over all all layers) of liquid water.
attributes.comment: The mass (summed over all all layers) of liquid water.

attributes.longname: Upward Ocean Mass Transport
attributes.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Upward mass transport from resolved and parameterized advective transport.
attributes.comment: Upward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.

attributes.longname: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: at the top of the atmosphere
attributes.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

attributes.longname: Height of Crops
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where crops (comment: mask=cropFrac)
attributes.description: Vegetation height averaged over the crop fraction of a grid cell.
attributes.comment: Vegetation height averaged over the crop fraction of a grid cell.

attributes.longname: Sea Water Potential Temperature
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.
attributes.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

attributes.longname: Northward Ocean Salt Transport Due to Overturning
attributes.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
attributes.description: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
attributes.comment: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

attributes.longname: Total Land NOx Flux
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. "Nox" means a combination of two radical species containing nitrogen and oxygen NO+NO2. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.
attributes.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. "Nox" means a combination of two radical species containing nitrogen and oxygen NO+NO2. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

attributes.longname: Mass Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Chlorophyll from diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone
attributes.comment: chlorophyll from diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

attributes.longname: Water Vapor Path
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column
attributes.comment: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

attributes.longname: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Flux of carbon-13 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.
attributes.comment: Flux of carbon-13 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Soil on Grass Tiles
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac)
attributes.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The "soil content" of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including content_of_soil_layer are used.
attributes.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The "soil content" of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including content_of_soil_layer are used.

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.
attributes.comment: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.

attributes.longname: Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
attributes.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

attributes.longname: Sea Water Conservative Temperature
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Sea water conservative temperature (this should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field)
attributes.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

attributes.longname: Autotrophic Respiration on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac)
attributes.description: Total RA of shrubs in the grid cell
attributes.comment: Total RA of shrubs in the grid cell

attributes.longname: Nitrogen Limitation of Picophytoplankton
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.
attributes.comment: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

attributes.longname: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
attributes.comment: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.

attributes.longname: Net Primary Production Allocated to Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: added for completeness with npp_root
attributes.comment: added for completeness with npp_root

attributes.longname: Carbonate Ion Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).
attributes.comment: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).

attributes.longname: Sea-Ice Area Flux Through Straits
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean
attributes.description: net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelago = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Bering Strait = (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N)
attributes.comment: Flux across 4 straits

attributes.longname: Net Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac)
attributes.description: Total NPP of shrubs in the grid cell
attributes.comment: Total NPP of shrubs in the grid cell

attributes.longname: Sea-Ice Freeboard
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: Mean height of sea-ice surface (=snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level
attributes.comment: Mean height of sea-ice surface (=snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level

attributes.longname: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Evaporation and Sublimation
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: The rate of change of sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation divided by grid-cell area
attributes.comment: The rate of change of sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation divided by grid-cell area

attributes.longname: Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2.
attributes.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2.

attributes.longname: Permafrost Layer Thickness
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: The mean thickness of the permafrost layer in the land portion of the grid cell.  Reported as zero in permafrost-free regions.
attributes.comment: where land over land: This is the mean thickness of the permafrost layer in the land portion of the grid cell.  Reported as missing in permafrost-free regions.

attributes.longname: pH
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: negative log of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.
attributes.comment: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

attributes.longname: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
attributes.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
attributes.description: Report only if there is a submesoscale eddy parameterization.
attributes.comment: Report only if there is a submesoscale eddy parameterization.

attributes.longname: Snow Internal Temperature
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean (with samples weighted by snow mass)
attributes.description: This temperature is averaged over all the snow in the grid cell that rests on land or land ice.  When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as missing in regions free of snow on land.
attributes.comment: This temperature is averaged over all the snow in the grid cell that rests on land or land ice.  When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as "missing in regions free of snow on land.

attributes.longname: Snowfall Flux where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
attributes.description: At surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase
attributes.comment: computed as the total mass per unit time of solid-phase precipitation falling into the ice-free portion of the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.   (Snowfall flux includes all types of solid-phase precipitation.)

attributes.longname: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: This variable measures the virtual salt flux into sea water due to the melting of sea ice. It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.
attributes.comment: This variable measures the virtual salt flux into sea water due to the melting of sea ice. It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

attributes.longname: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.
attributes.comment: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

attributes.longname: Downward Inorganic Carbon Flux at Ocean Bottom
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Inorganic Carbon loss to sediments
attributes.comment: Inorganic Carbon loss to sediments

attributes.longname: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.
attributes.comment: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.

attributes.longname: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Silicon

attributes.longname: Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

attributes.comment: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone

attributes.longname: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_mortality and mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_senescence is mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation.
attributes.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_mortality and mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_senescence is mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation.

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

attributes.longname: Snow Depth
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: where land over land, this is computed as the mean thickness of snow in the land portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire land portion, including the snow-free fraction).  Reported as 0.0 where the land fraction is 0.

attributes.longname: Downward Flux of Particulate Phosphorus
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
attributes.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

attributes.longname: Net Flux of CO2 Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).
attributes.comment: Flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).

However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

attributes.description: Difference in partial pressure of natural-analogue carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  A natural analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings.
attributes.comment: Difference in partial pressure of natural-analogue carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  A natural analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings.

attributes.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean

attributes.longname: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

attributes.longname: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Snow Thermodynamics
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "Snow thermodynamics" refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.
attributes.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "Snow thermodynamics" refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.

attributes.longname: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Growth in Supercooled Open Water (Frazil)
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to sea ice formation in supercooled water (often through frazil formation) divided by grid-cell area. Together, sidmassgrowthwat and sidmassgrowthbot should give total ice growth
attributes.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to sea ice formation in supercooled water (often through frazil formation) divided by grid-cell area. Together, sidmassgrowthwat and sidmassgrowthbot should give total ice growth

attributes.longname: Net Primary Production Allocated to Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: This is the rate of carbon uptake by roots due to NPP
attributes.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by roots due to NPP

attributes.longname: Total Nitrogen Loss to Leaching or Runoff (Sum of Ammonium, Nitrite and Nitrate)
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Leaching" means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil. Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, "runoff" refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage.
attributes.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Leaching" means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil. Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, "runoff" refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage.

attributes.longname: Nitrogen Production
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Vertically integrated biogenic nitrogen production
attributes.comment: Vertically integrated biogenic nitrogen production

attributes.longname: Surface Dissolved Ammonium Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
attributes.comment: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

attributes.longname: Mole Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: carbon concentration from calcareous (calcite-producing) phytoplankton component alone
attributes.comment: carbon concentration from calcareous (calcite-producing) phytoplankton component alone

attributes.longname: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Picophytoplankton
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Primary (organic carbon) production by the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone
attributes.comment: Primary (organic carbon) production by the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

attributes.longname: Sea-Surface Tilt Term in Force Balance (X-Component)
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: X-component of force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt
attributes.comment: X-component of force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt

attributes.longname: C3 Natural Grass Area Percentage
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 natural grass.
attributes.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 natural grass.

attributes.longname: Sea Water Transport
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean
attributes.description: Transport across_line means that which crosses a particular line on the Earth's surface; formally this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the transport.
attributes.comment: Transport across_line means that which crosses a particular line on the Earth's surface; formally this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the transport. The transport should be evaluated for the full depth of the ocean, except for the Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is averaged from the surface to 350m.

attributes.longname: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Gyre
attributes.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
attributes.description: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
attributes.comment: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

attributes.longname: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as Natural CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Gas exchange flux of natural CO2 (positive into ocean)
attributes.comment: Gas exchange flux of natural CO2 (positive into ocean)

attributes.longname: Transpiration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Transpiration (may include dew formation as a negative flux).
attributes.comment: Transpiration (may include dew formation as a negative flux).

attributes.longname: Nitrogen Mass in Above-Ground Litter (non CWD)
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Surface litter" means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.
attributes.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Surface litter" means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

attributes.longname: Mineral Nitrogen in the Soil
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: SUM of ammonium, nitrite, nitrate, etc over all soil layers
attributes.comment: SUM of ammonium, nitrite, nitrate, etc over all soil layers

attributes.longname: Sinking Particulate Iron Flux
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
attributes.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

attributes.longname: Upwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconca)
attributes.description: The upwelling shortwave flux over sea ice (always negative)
attributes.comment: The upwelling shortwave flux over sea ice (always negative)

attributes.longname: Snow Soot Content
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: the entire land portion of the grid cell is considered, with snow soot content set to 0.0 in regions free of snow.
attributes.comment: the entire land portion of the grid cell is considered, with snow soot content set to 0.0 in regions free of snow.

attributes.longname: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Calcareous Phytoplankton
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the calcareous phytoplankton component alone
attributes.comment: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the calcareous phytoplankton component alone

attributes.longname: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Air Temperature
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean time: maximum within days time: mean over days
attributes.description: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute "time: max")
attributes.comment: monthly mean of the daily-maximum near-surface air temperature.

attributes.longname: Freshwater Flux from Sea Ice
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area; This flux is negative during ice growth (liquid water mass decreases, hence upward flux of freshwater), positive during ice melt (liquid water mass increases, hence downward flux of freshwater)
attributes.comment: Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area; This flux is negative during ice growth (liquid water mass decreases, hence upward flux of freshwater), positive during ice melt (liquid water mass increases, hence downward flux of freshwater)

attributes.longname: Heat Flux Correction
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Flux correction is also called "flux adjustment". A positive flux correction is downward i.e. added to the ocean. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
attributes.comment: Flux correction is also called "flux adjustment". A positive flux correction is downward i.e. added to the ocean. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

attributes.longname: Percentage of Entire Grid Cell That Is Covered by Burnt Vegetation (All Classes)
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.description: Percentage of grid cell burned due to all fires including natural and anthropogenic fires and those associated with anthropogenic Land-use change
attributes.comment: Percentage of grid cell burned due to all fires including natural and anthropogenic fires and those associated with anthropogenic land use change

attributes.longname: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: There is no CMIP6 request for zosga nor zossga.
attributes.comment: There is no CMIP6 request for zosga nor zossga.

attributes.longname: Downward Flux of Particulate Nitrogen
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
attributes.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

attributes.longname: Average Normal Stress in Sea Ice
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) time: point
attributes.time_title: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value)
attributes.description: Average normal stress in sea ice (first stress invariant)
attributes.comment: Average normal stress in sea ice (first stress invariant)

attributes.longname: Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration
attributes.comment: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

attributes.longname: Bare Soil Percentage Area Coverage
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil.
attributes.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil.

attributes.longname: Mineral Ammonium in the Soil
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: SUM of ammonium over all soil layers
attributes.comment: SUM of ammonium over all soil layers

attributes.longname: Downward Flux of Aragonite
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Downward flux of Aragonite
attributes.comment: Downward flux of Aragonite

attributes.longname: Primary Organic Carbon Production by Phytoplankton Based on Nitrate Uptake Alone
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton based on nitrate uptake alone
attributes.comment: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton based on nitrate uptake alone

attributes.longname: Freshwater Flux from Sea-Ice Surface
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: Total flux of fresh water from sea-ice surface into underlying ocean. This combines both surface melt water that drains directly into the ocean and the drainage of surface melt pond. By definition, this flux is always positive.
attributes.comment: Total flux of fresh water from sea-ice surface into underlying ocean. This combines both surface melt water that drains directly into the ocean and the drainage of surface melt pond. By definition, this flux is always positive.

attributes.longname: Sea Surface Temperature
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Temperature of upper boundary of the liquid ocean, including temperatures below sea-ice and floating ice shelves.
attributes.comment: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature.

attributes.longname: Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content.  Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh.
attributes.comment: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content.  Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh.

attributes.longname: Gross Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac)
attributes.description: Total GPP of shrubs in the grid cell
attributes.comment: Total GPP of shrubs in the grid cell

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stems and Roots
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: E.g. fruits, seeds, etc.
attributes.comment: E.g. fruits, seeds, etc.

attributes.longname: Snow Thickness
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where snow over sea_ice area: time: mean where sea_ice
attributes.description: Actual thickness of snow (snow volume divided by snow-covered area)
attributes.comment: (in OImon, snd was volume per entire cell area)

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Tree Tiles
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac)
attributes.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.
attributes.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.

attributes.longname: Leaf Area Index
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.
attributes.comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

attributes.longname: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Due to Biological Activity
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
attributes.description: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic silicate
attributes.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic silicon

attributes.longname: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: computed as the iceberg melt water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
attributes.comment: computed as the iceberg melt water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

attributes.longname: Pressure on Model Half-Levels
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years
attributes.description: Air pressure on model half-levels
attributes.comment: Air pressure on model half-levels

attributes.longname: Sea-Ice Area Percentage Tendency Due to Thermodynamics
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through thermodynamic processes
attributes.comment: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through thermodynamic processes

attributes.longname: X-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: X-component of ocean stress on sea ice
attributes.comment: X-component of ocean stress on sea ice

attributes.longname: Nitrogen Loss to Sediments and Through Denitrification
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase. 'Denitrification' is the conversion of nitrate into gaseous compounds such as nitric oxide, nitrous oxide and molecular nitrogen which are then emitted to the atmosphere.  'Sedimentation' is the sinking of particulate matter to the floor of a body of water. "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.
attributes.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase. 'Denitrification' is the conversion of nitrate into gaseous compounds such as nitric oxide, nitrous oxide and molecular nitrogen which are then emitted to the atmosphere.  'Sedimentation' is the sinking of particulate matter to the floor of a body of water. "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

attributes.longname: Calcite Saturation Depth
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Depth of calcite saturation horizon (0 if undersaturated at all depths, and missing saturated through whole depth; if two or more horizons exist, then the shallowest is reported)
attributes.comment: Depth of calcite saturation horizon (0 if < surface, "missing" if > bottom, if two, then the shallower)

attributes.longname: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Gas exchange flux of CO2 (positive into ocean)
attributes.comment: Gas exchange flux of CO2 (positive into ocean)

attributes.longname: Surface Natural Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2
attributes.comment: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2

attributes.longname: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Iron Due to Biological Activity
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
attributes.description: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron
attributes.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron

attributes.longname: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  " Iceberg thermodynamics" refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.

attributes.longname: Surface Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: carbon  concentration from mesozooplankton (20-200 um) component alone
attributes.comment: carbon  concentration from mesozooplankton (20-200 um) component alone

attributes.longname: Rainfall Rate over Sea Ice
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: mass of liquid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area
attributes.comment: mass of liquid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area

attributes.longname: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: the rate of change of snow mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by sea-ice area
attributes.comment: the rate of change of snow mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by sea-ice area

attributes.longname: Downward Flux of Calcite
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Standard names also exist for aragonite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.
attributes.comment: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Standard names also exist for aragonite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.

attributes.longname: Total Soil Moisture Content
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.
attributes.comment: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.

attributes.longname: Nitrogen Limitation of Other Phytoplankton
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Miscellaneous phytoplankton" are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.
attributes.comment: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Miscellaneous phytoplankton" are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

attributes.longname: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
attributes.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
attributes.description: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced diffusive transport (i.e., neutral diffusion). Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.
attributes.comment: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced diffusive transport (i.e., neutral diffusion). Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.

attributes.longname: Surface Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations at the sea surface.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of 'Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration' plus 'Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration'
attributes.comment: sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of "Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration" plus "Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration"

attributes.longname: Percentage Cover of Sea Ice by Ridging
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: Fraction of sea ice, by area, which is covered by sea ice ridges, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice .
attributes.comment: Fraction of sea ice, by area, which is covered by sea ice ridges, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice .

attributes.longname: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. Calculate as the mass of cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cells. Precipitating hydrometeors are included ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
attributes.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  Calculate as the mass of cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cells. Precipitating hydrometeors are included ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

attributes.longname: Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.
attributes.comment: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.

attributes.longname: Irradiance Limitation of Picophytoplankton
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Growth limitation of picophytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.
attributes.comment: Growth limitation of picophytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

attributes.longname: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Melt

attributes.comment: the rate of change of snow mass through melt divided by sea-ice area

attributes.longname: Net Primary Production on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac)

attributes.longname: Surface Aragonite Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

attributes.comment: sum of particulate aragonite components (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

attributes.longname: X-Component of Sea-Ice Velocity
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: The x-velocity of ice on native model grid

attributes.longname: Surface Runoff
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: The total surface run off leaving the land portion of the grid cell (excluding drainage through the base of the soil model).
attributes.comment: the total surface runoff leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

attributes.longname: Total Respiration from Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: added for completeness with Ra_root
attributes.comment: added for completeness with Ra_root

attributes.longname: Liquid Water Content of Permafrost Layer
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

attributes.longname: Total Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic silicon" means the sum of all inorganic silicon in solution (including silicic acid and its first dissociated anion SiO(OH)3-).
attributes.comment: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Soil on Shrub Tiles
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac)
attributes.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The "soil content" of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac)

"Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.
