attributes.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. "Dissolved inorganic carbon" describes a family of chemical species in solution, including carbon dioxide, carbonic acid and the carbonate and bicarbonate anions. "Dissolved inorganic carbon" is the term used in standard names for all species belonging to the family that are represented within a given model. The list of individual species that are included in a quantity having a group chemical standard name can vary between models.  Where possible, the data variable should be accompanied by a complete description of the species represented, for example, by using a comment attribute.
attributes.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. "Dissolved inorganic carbon" describes a family of chemical species in solution, including carbon dioxide, carbonic acid and the carbonate and bicarbonate anions. "Dissolved inorganic carbon" is the term used in standard names for all species belonging to the family that are represented within a given model. attributes.longname: Turnover Rate of Each Model Soil Carbon Pool

attributes.description: defined as 1/(turnover time) for each soil pool. Use the same pools reported under cSoilPools
attributes.comment: defined as 1/(turnover time) for each soil pool. Use the same pools reported under cSoilPools

attributes.longname: Net Downward Shortwave Radiation at Sea Water Surface
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: This is the flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.
attributes.comment: This is the flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.

attributes.longname: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: The mass of water in all phases in the upper 10cm of the  soil layer.
attributes.comment: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.

attributes.longname: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Bottom Melting
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice bottom divided by grid-cell area
attributes.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice bottom divided by grid-cell area

attributes.longname: Water Flux into Sea Water Without Flux Correction
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Computed as the water flux (without flux correction) into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
attributes.comment: Computed as the water flux (without flux correction) into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

attributes.longname: Nitrogen Limitation of Diatoms
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.
attributes.comment: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

attributes.longname: Near-Surface Wind Speed
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.
attributes.comment: This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind

attributes.longname: Nitrogen Mass in Leaves
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.
attributes.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.

attributes.longname: Sea Mass Area Flux Through Straits
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean
attributes.description: net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelago = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Bering Strait = (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N)
attributes.comment: Flux across 4 straits

attributes.longname: Geopotential Height
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean
attributes.description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
attributes.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

attributes.longname: Mole Fraction of CO2
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years
attributes.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
attributes.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

attributes.longname: Mole Concentration of CFC12 in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen". The chemical formula for CFC12 is CF2Cl2. The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane.
attributes.comment: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen". The chemical formula for CFC12 is CF2Cl2. The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane.

attributes.longname: Global Mean Sea Water Salinity
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.
attributes.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. attributes.description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
attributes.comment: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

attributes.longname: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  " Iceberg thermodynamics" refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.

"Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

attributes.longname: Square of Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: The phrase "square_of_X" means X*X. The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by "temperature", "sigma", "sigma_theta", "sigma_t" or vertical diffusivity is the level at which the quantity indicated differs from its surface value by a certain amount. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name sea_water_sigma_t_difference can be used to specify the sigma_t criterion that determines the layer thickness. Sigma-t of sea water is the density of water at atmospheric pressure (i.e. the surface) having the same temperature and salinity, minus 1000 kg m-3. "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer.
attributes.comment: The phrase "square_of_X" means X*X. The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by "temperature", "sigma", "sigma_theta", "sigma_t" or vertical diffusivity is the level at which the quantity indicated differs from its surface value by a certain amount. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name sea_water_sigma_t_difference can be used to specify the sigma_t criterion that determines the layer thickness. Sigma-t of sea water is the density of water at atmospheric pressure (i.e. the surface) having the same temperature and salinity, minus 1000 kg m-3. "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer.

attributes.description: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.   Use Celsius for temperature scale.
attributes.comment: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.   Use Celsius for temperature scale.

attributes.longname: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean grid_longitude: mean
attributes.description: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.
attributes.comment: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.

attributes.longname: Fraction of Time Convection Occurs in Cell

attributes.longname: Surface Zooplankton Carbon Concentration

attributes.comment: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area

attributes.comment: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

attributes.longname: Snow Area Percentage
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
attributes.description: Percentage of sea ice, by area, which is covered by snow, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice . Exclude snow that lies on land or land ice.
attributes.comment: Percentage of sea ice, by area, which is covered by snow, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice . Exclude snow that lies on land or land ice.

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

attributes.longname: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean

attributes.comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere

attributes.longname: Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
attributes.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.

attributes.longname: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Frazil Ice Formation
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Frazil" consists of needle like crystals of ice, typically between three and four millimeters in diameter, which form as sea water begins to freeze. Salt is expelled during the freezing process and frazil ice consists of nearly pure fresh water.
attributes.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Frazil" consists of needle like crystals of ice, typically between three and four millimeters in diameter, which form as sea water begins to freeze. Salt is expelled during the freezing process and frazil ice consists of nearly pure fresh water.

attributes.longname: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
attributes.cell_methods: time: mean grid_longitude: mean

attributes.comment: vertical integral of net  time rate of change of phosphate

attributes.longname: Snowfall Flux
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: At surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase
attributes.comment: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

attributes.longname: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Evaporation
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: zero for models using real water fluxes.
attributes.comment: zero for models using real water fluxes.

attributes.longname: Iron Limitation of Diatoms
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.
attributes.comment: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

attributes.longname: Mole Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: carbon concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone
attributes.comment: carbon concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

attributes.longname: Primary Organic Carbon Production by All Types of Phytoplankton
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton.  This should equal the sum of intpdiat+intpphymisc, but those individual components may be unavailable in some models.
attributes.comment: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton.  This should equal the sum of intpdiat+intpphymisc, but those individual components may be unavailable in some models.

attributes.longname: Total Vegetated Percentage Cover
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.description: Percentage of grid cell that is covered by vegetation.This SHOULD be the sum of tree, grass (natural and pasture), crop and shrub fractions.
attributes.comment: Percentage of grid cell that is covered by vegetation.This SHOULD be the sum of tree, grass (natural and pasture), crop and shrub fractions.

attributes.longname: Downward Flux of Particulate Iron
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
attributes.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Model Soil Pool
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Carbon mass in the full depth of the soil model.
attributes.comment: Carbon mass in the full depth of the soil model.

attributes.longname: Surface Dissolved Oxygen Concentration at Saturation
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: "Mole concentration at saturation" means the mole concentration in a saturated solution. Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen".
attributes.comment: "Mole concentration at saturation" means the mole concentration in a saturated solution. Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen".

attributes.longname: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Downward flux of particulate organic carbon
attributes.comment: Downward flux of particulate organic carbon

attributes.longname: Square of Brunt Vaisala Frequency in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: The phrase "square_of_X" means X*X. Frequency is the number of oscillations of a wave per unit time. Brunt-Vaisala frequency is also sometimes called "buoyancy frequency" and is a measure of the vertical stratification of the medium.
attributes.comment: The phrase "square_of_X" means X*X. Frequency is the number of oscillations of a wave per unit time. Brunt-Vaisala frequency is also sometimes called "buoyancy frequency" and is a measure of the vertical stratification of the medium.

attributes.longname: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Atmosphere as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
attributes.comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

attributes.longname: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Overturning
attributes.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
attributes.description: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
attributes.comment: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

attributes.longname: Mole Concentration of Dimethyl Sulphide in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Mole concentration of dimethyl sulphide in water
attributes.comment: Mole concentration of dimethyl sulphide in water

attributes.longname: Convective Mass Flux
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  The flux is computed as the mass divided by the area of the grid cell.
attributes.comment: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  The flux is computed as the mass divided by the area of the grid cell.

attributes.longname: Dissolved Oxygen Concentration at Saturation
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: "Mole concentration at saturation" means the mole concentration in a saturated solution. Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen".
attributes.comment: "Mole concentration at saturation" means the mole concentration in a saturated solution. Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen".

attributes.longname: Surface Dissolved Nitrate Concentration
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
attributes.comment: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Litter Pool
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.
attributes.comment: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.

attributes.longname: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Mortality
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
attributes.comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

attributes.longname: Surface Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

attributes.comment: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone

attributes.longname: Thickness of Refrozen Ice on Melt Pond
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice_melt_pond (comment: mask=simpconc)
attributes.description: Volume of refrozen ice on melt ponds divided by meltpond covered area
attributes.comment: Volume of refrozen ice on melt ponds divided by meltpond covered area

attributes.longname: Surface Natural pH
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.
attributes.comment: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

attributes.longname: Meltpond Mass per Unit Area (as Depth)
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice_melt_pond (comment: mask=simpconc)
attributes.description: Meltpond Depth
attributes.comment: Meltpond Depth

attributes.longname: Surface Mole Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: carbon from the diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone
attributes.comment: carbon from the diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

attributes.longname: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
attributes.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
attributes.description: Report only if there is a submesoscale eddy parameterization.
attributes.comment: Report only if there is a submesoscale eddy parameterization.

attributes.longname: Global Average Sea Surface Temperature
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Temperature of upper boundary of the liquid ocean, including temperatures below sea-ice and floating ice shelves.
attributes.comment: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature.

attributes.longname: Net Mass Flux of 14C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Flux of carbon-14 as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).
attributes.comment: Flux of carbon-14 as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).

attributes.longname: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: In some models part of nitrogen (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.
attributes.comment: In some models part of nitrogen (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.

attributes.longname: Nitrogen Limitation of Calcareous Phytoplankton
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: "Calcareous phytoplankton" are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.
attributes.comment: "Calcareous phytoplankton" are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

attributes.longname: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux over Sea Ice
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconca)
attributes.description: the net sensible heat flux over sea ice
attributes.comment: the net sensible heat flux over sea ice

attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Pool (Summed over Vertical Levels)
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: For models with multiple soil carbon pools, report each pool here. If models also have vertical discretisation these should be aggregated
attributes.comment: For models with multiple soil carbon pools, report each pool here. If models also have vertical discretisation these should be aggregated

attributes.longname: TOA Incident Shortwave Radiation
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean

attributes.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

attributes.longname: Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.
attributes.comment: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

attributes.longname: Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: The total mass of liquid water contained interstitially within the whole depth of the snow layer of the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.
attributes.comment: where land over land: this is computed as the total mass of liquid water contained interstitially within the snow layer of the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.

attributes.longname: Surface Mass Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: chlorophyll concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone
attributes.comment: chlorophyll concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

attributes.longname: Mass of 13C in Soil Pool
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in soil.
attributes.comment: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in soil.

attributes.longname: Evaporation from Canopy
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: The canopy evaporation and sublimation (if present in model); may include dew formation as a negative flux.
attributes.comment: the canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).

attributes.longname: Sea-Ice Heat Content per Unit Area
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Water at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine. Heat content is always negative, since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water
attributes.comment: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Water at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine. Heat content is always negative, since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water

attributes.longname: Sea Water Pressure at Sea Floor
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
attributes.description: "Sea water pressure" is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.
attributes.comment: "Sea water pressure" is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.

attributes.longname: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
attributes.cell_methods: area: time: mean
attributes.description: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.
attributes.comment: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

attributes.longname: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Flux of carbon-14 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.
attributes.comment: Flux of carbon-14 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.

attributes.longname: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Nitrogen Due to Biological Activity
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
attributes.description: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4)
attributes.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4)

attributes.longname: Deforested or Harvested Biomass as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use or Change
attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
attributes.comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

attributes.description: Flux of nitrogen into the ocean due to deposition (sum of dry and wet deposition), fixation (the production of ammonia from nitrogen gas by diazotrophs) and runoff (liquid water which drains from land).

attributes.longname: Sinking Particulate Organic Nitrogen Flux

attributes.comment: Flux across 4 straits

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.description: Flux of carbon 31as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).-

attributes.longname: Dissolved Nitrate Concentration

attributes.description: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
